p: Baicalin interacted at the interface between ACE2 receptor and Spike protein through Asp67, Ala71, Lys74, and Asn448, Ala464, Val472 and Gly474 residues, respectively. These in silico results were validated by in vitro experiments, having an IC 50 around 2.24 ÂµM on inhibiting the Spike protein and ACE2 receptor binding [ 138].
